holidays.name: National Tortilla Chip Day
holidays.description: A crunchy celebration honoring the delicious, salty snack that turns just about any dip into a fiesta!
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday celebrates the tortilla chip, which originated in Mexico and became popular in the United States during the 20th century.

holidays.name: World Bartender Day
holidays.description: A day to tip your hat and your glass to the bartenders mixing magic behind the bar.
holidays.origin: Started in 2009 by the International Bartenders Association to recognize and celebrate bartenders worldwide.

holidays.name: Rare Disease Day (February 24 in some years)
holidays.description: Raising awareness for the millions of people worldwide affected by rare diseases, often overlooked by medical research.
holidays.origin: Established in 2008 by EURORDIS, the European rare disease organization, observed on the last day of February unless in leap years falling on the 24th.
holidays.funFact: Despite being individually rare, there are over 7,000 known rare diseases affecting approximately 400 million people globally.

holidays.name: National Tortellini Day
holidays.description: An ode to the tiny ring-shaped pasta stuffed with savory fillings that is a staple in Italian cuisine.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday celebrating tortellini, inspired by its Italian culinary heritage dating back to the Middle Ages.
